noun.description: Chiefly in plural Either of the two deputies sent by each constituent State to the Amphictyonic Council.

origin: Late 16th century. From ancient Greek Πυλαγόρας delegate sent to the Amphictyonic Council from Πύλαι, the name of the Thermopylae (the older place of assembly of the Pythian Amphictyony) + ἀγορά.
